scalar_group.c

00001 #include <net-snmp/net-snmp-config.h>
00002 
00003 #include <stdlib.h>
00004 #if HAVE_STRING_H
00005 #include <string.h>
00006 #else
00007 #include <strings.h>
00008 #endif
00009 
00010 #include <net-snmp/net-snmp-includes.h>
00011 #include <net-snmp/agent/net-snmp-agent-includes.h>
00012 
00013 #include <net-snmp/agent/scalar_group.h>
00014 #include <net-snmp/agent/scalar.h>
00015 #include <net-snmp/agent/serialize.h>
00016 #include <net-snmp/agent/read_only.h>
00017 
00022 netsnmp_mib_handler *
00023 netsnmp_get_scalar_group_handler(oid first, oid last)
00024 {
00025     netsnmp_mib_handler  *ret    = NULL;
00026     netsnmp_scalar_group *sgroup = NULL;
00027 
00028     ret = netsnmp_create_handler("scalar_group",
00029                                   netsnmp_scalar_group_helper_handler);
00030     if (ret) {
00031         sgroup = SNMP_MALLOC_TYPEDEF(netsnmp_scalar_group);
00032         if (NULL == sgroup) {
00033             netsnmp_handler_free(ret);
00034             ret = NULL;
00035         }
00036         else {
00037             sgroup->lbound = first;
00038             sgroup->ubound = last;
00039             ret->myvoid = (void *)sgroup;
00040         }
00041     }
00042     return ret;
00043 }
00044 
00045 int
00046 netsnmp_register_scalar_group(netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
00047                               oid first, oid last)
00048 {
00049     netsnmp_inject_handler(reginfo, netsnmp_get_instance_handler());
00050     netsnmp_inject_handler(reginfo, netsnmp_get_scalar_handler());
00051     netsnmp_inject_handler(reginfo, netsnmp_get_scalar_group_handler(first, last));
00052     return netsnmp_register_serialize(reginfo);
00053 }
00054 
00055 
00056 int
00057 netsnmp_scalar_group_helper_handler(netsnmp_mib_handler *handler,
00058                                 netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
00059                                 netsnmp_agent_request_info *reqinfo,
00060                                 netsnmp_request_info *requests)
00061 {
00062     netsnmp_variable_list *var = requests->requestvb;
00063 
00064     netsnmp_scalar_group *sgroup = (netsnmp_scalar_group *)handler->myvoid;
00065     int             ret, cmp;
00066     int             namelen;
00067     oid             subid, root_tmp[MAX_OID_LEN], *root_save;
00068 
00069     DEBUGMSGTL(("helper:scalar_group", "Got request:\n"));
00070     namelen = SNMP_MIN(requests->requestvb->name_length,
00071                        reginfo->rootoid_len);
00072     cmp = snmp_oid_compare(requests->requestvb->name, namelen,
00073                            reginfo->rootoid, reginfo->rootoid_len);
00074 
00075     DEBUGMSGTL(( "helper:scalar_group", "  cmp=%d, oid:", cmp));
00076     DEBUGMSGOID(("helper:scalar_group", var->name, var->name_length));
00077     DEBUGMSG((   "helper:scalar_group", "\n"));
00078 
00079     /*
00080      * copy root oid to root_tmp, set instance to 0. (subid set later on)
00081      * save rootoid, since we'll replace it before calling next handler,
00082      * and need to restore it afterwards.
00083      */
00084     memcpy(root_tmp, reginfo->rootoid, reginfo->rootoid_len * sizeof(oid));
00085     root_tmp[reginfo->rootoid_len + 1] = 0;
00086     root_save = reginfo->rootoid;
00087 
00088     ret = SNMP_ERR_NOCREATION;
00089     switch (reqinfo->mode) {
00090     /*
00091      * The handling of "exact" requests is basically the same.
00092      * The only difference between GET and SET requests is the
00093      *     error/exception to return on failure.
00094      */
00095     case MODE_GET:
00096         ret = SNMP_NOSUCHOBJECT;
00097         /* Fallthrough */
00098 
00099     case MODE_SET_RESERVE1:
00100     case MODE_SET_RESERVE2:
00101     case MODE_SET_ACTION:
00102     case MODE_SET_COMMIT:
00103     case MODE_SET_UNDO:
00104     case MODE_SET_FREE:
00105         if (cmp != 0 ||
00106             requests->requestvb->name_length <= reginfo->rootoid_len) {
00107             /*
00108              * Common prefix doesn't match, or only *just* matches 
00109              *  the registered root (so can't possibly match a scalar)
00110              */
00111             netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, ret);
00112             return SNMP_ERR_NOERROR;
00113         } else {
00114             /*
00115              * Otherwise,
00116              *     extract the object subidentifier from the request, 
00117              *     check this is (probably) valid, and then fudge the
00118              *     registered 'rootoid' to match, before passing the
00119              *     request off to the next handler ('scalar').
00120              *
00121              * Note that we don't bother checking instance subidentifiers
00122              *     here.  That's left to the scalar helper.
00123              */
00124             subid = requests->requestvb->name[reginfo->rootoid_len];
00125             if (subid < sgroup->lbound ||
00126                 subid > sgroup->ubound) {
00127                 netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, ret);
00128                 return SNMP_ERR_NOERROR;
00129             }
00130             root_tmp[reginfo->rootoid_len++] = subid;
00131             reginfo->rootoid = root_tmp;
00132             ret = netsnmp_call_next_handler(handler, reginfo, reqinfo,
00133                                             requests);
00134             reginfo->rootoid = root_save;
00135             reginfo->rootoid_len--;
00136             return ret;
00137         }
00138         break;
00139 
00140     case MODE_GETNEXT:
00141         /*
00142          * If we're being asked for something before (or exactly matches)
00143          *     the registered root OID, then start with the first object.
00144          * If we're being asked for something that exactly matches an object
00145          *    OID, then that's what we pass down.
00146          * Otherwise, we pass down the OID of the *next* object....
00147          */
00148         if (cmp < 0 ||
00149             requests->requestvb->name_length <= reginfo->rootoid_len) {
00150             subid  = sgroup->lbound;
00151         } else if (requests->requestvb->name_length == reginfo->rootoid_len+1)
00152             subid = requests->requestvb->name[reginfo->rootoid_len];
00153         else
00154             subid = requests->requestvb->name[reginfo->rootoid_len]+1;
00155 
00156         /*
00157          * ... always assuming this is (potentially) valid, of course.
00158          */
00159         if (subid > sgroup->ubound)
00160             return SNMP_ERR_NOERROR;
00161         
00162         root_tmp[reginfo->rootoid_len++] = subid;
00163         reginfo->rootoid = root_tmp;
00164         ret = netsnmp_call_next_handler(handler, reginfo, reqinfo,
00165                                             requests);
00166         /*
00167          * If we didn't get an answer (due to holes in the group)
00168          *   set things up to retry again.
00169          */
00170         if (!requests->delegated &&
00171             (requests->requestvb->type == ASN_NULL ||
00172              requests->requestvb->type == SNMP_NOSUCHOBJECT ||
00173              requests->requestvb->type == SNMP_NOSUCHINSTANCE)) {
00174             snmp_set_var_objid(requests->requestvb,
00175                                reginfo->rootoid, reginfo->rootoid_len);
00176             requests->requestvb->name[reginfo->rootoid_len-1] = ++subid;
00177             requests->requestvb->type = ASN_PRIV_RETRY;
00178         }
00179         reginfo->rootoid = root_save;
00180         reginfo->rootoid_len--;
00181         return ret;
00182     }
00183     /*
00184      * got here only if illegal mode found 
00185      */
00186     return SNMP_ERR_GENERR;
00187 }
